sn46.33:1.1.pli: “Pañcime, bhikkhave, jātarūpassa upakkilesā, yehi upakkilesehi upakkiliṭṭhaṃ jātarūpaṃ na ceva mudu hoti na ca kammaniyaṃ, na ca pabhassaraṃ pabhaṅgu ca, na ca sammā upeti kammāya.
sn46.33:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are these five corruptions of native gold. When native gold is corrupted by these it’s not pliable, workable, or radiant, but is brittle and not completely ready for working.

sn46.33:1.3.pli: Ayo, bhikkhave, jātarūpassa upakkileso, yena upakkilesena upakkiliṭṭhaṃ jātarūpaṃ na ceva mudu hoti na ca kammaniyaṃ, na ca pabhassaraṃ pabhaṅgu ca, na ca sammā upeti kammāya.

sn46.33:1.4.pli: Lohaṃ, bhikkhave, jātarūpassa upakkileso, yena upakkilesena upakkiliṭṭhaṃ jātarūpaṃ …pe…

sn46.33:1.7.pli: sajjhu, bhikkhave, jātarūpassa upakkileso, yena upakkilesena upakkiliṭṭhaṃ jātarūpaṃ na ceva mudu hoti na ca kammaniyaṃ, na ca pabhassaraṃ pabhaṅgu ca, na ca sammā upeti kammāya.

sn46.33:1.8.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca jātarūpassa upakkilesā, yehi upakkilesehi upakkiliṭṭhaṃ jātarūpaṃ na ceva mudu hoti na ca kammaniyaṃ, na ca pabhassaraṃ pabhaṅgu ca, na ca sammā upeti kammāya.
sn46.33:1.8.eng: When native gold is corrupted by these five corruptions it’s not pliable, workable, or radiant, but is brittle and not completely ready for working.

sn46.33:2.1.pli: Evameva kho, bhikkhave, pañcime cittassa upakkilesā, yehi upakkilesehi upakkiliṭṭhaṃ cittaṃ na ceva mudu hoti na ca kammaniyaṃ, na ca pabhassaraṃ pabhaṅgu ca, na ca sammā samādhiyati āsavānaṃ khayāya.
sn46.33:2.1.eng: In the same way, there are these five corruptions of the mind. When the mind is corrupted by these it’s not pliable, workable, or radiant. It’s brittle, and not rightly immersed in samādhi for the ending of defilements.

sn46.33:2.3.pli: Kāmacchando, bhikkhave, cittassa upakkileso, yena upakkilesena upakkiliṭṭhaṃ cittaṃ na ceva mudu hoti na ca kammaniyaṃ, na ca pabhassaraṃ pabhaṅgu ca, na ca sammā samādhiyati āsavānaṃ khayāya …pe…
sn46.33:2.3.eng: Sensual desire, ill will, dullness and drowsiness, restlessness and remorse, and doubt.

sn46.33:2.4.pli: ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca cittassa upakkilesā, yehi upakkilesehi upakkiliṭṭhaṃ cittaṃ na ceva mudu hoti na ca kammaniyaṃ, na ca pabhassaraṃ pabhaṅgu ca, na ca sammā samādhiyati āsavānaṃ khayāyā”ti.
sn46.33:2.4.eng: These are the five corruptions of the mind. When the mind is corrupted by these it’s not pliable, workable, or radiant. It’s brittle, and not rightly immersed in samādhi for the ending of defilements.”

sn46.34:1.1.pli: “Sattime, bhikkhave, bojjhaṅgā anāvaraṇā anīvaraṇā cetaso anupakkilesā bhāvitā bahulīkatā vijjāvimuttiphalasacchikiriyāya saṃvattanti.
sn46.34:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these seven awakening factors are not obstacles, hindrances, or corruptions of the mind. When developed and cultivated they lead to the realization of the fruit of knowledge and freedom.

sn46.34:1.3.pli: Satisambojjhaṅgo, bhikkhave, anāvaraṇo anīvaraṇo cetaso anupakkileso bhāvito bahulīkato vijjāvimuttiphalasacchikiriyāya saṃvattati …pe… upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo, bhikkhave, anāvaraṇo anīvaraṇo cetaso anupakkileso bhāvito bahulīkato vijjāvimuttiphalasacchikiriyāya saṃvattati.
sn46.34:1.3.eng: The awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.

sn46.34:1.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, satta bojjhaṅgā anāvaraṇā anīvaraṇā cetaso anupakkilesā bhāvitā bahulīkatā vijjāvimuttiphalasacchikiriyāya saṃvattantī”ti.
sn46.34:1.4.eng: These seven awakening factors are not obstacles, hindrances, or corruptions of the mind. When developed and cultivated they lead to the realization of the fruit of knowledge and freedom.”

sn46.35:1.1.pli: “Ayoniso, bhikkhave, manasikaroto anuppanno ceva kāmacchando uppajjati, uppanno ca kāmacchando bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati; anuppanno ceva byāpādo uppajjati, uppanno ca byāpādo bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati; anuppannañceva thinamiddhaṃ uppajjati, uppannañca thinamiddhaṃ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati; anuppannañceva uddhaccakukkuccaṃ uppajjati, uppannañca uddhaccakukkuccaṃ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati; anuppannā ceva vicikicchā uppajjati, uppannā ca vicikicchā bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattatī”ti.
sn46.35:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, when you apply the mind irrationally, sensual desire, ill will, dullness and drowsiness, restlessness and remorse, and doubt arise, and once arisen they increase and grow.”

sn46.35:2.1.pli: “Yoniso ca kho, bhikkhave, manasikaroto anuppanno ceva satisambojjhaṅgo uppajjati, uppanno ca satisambojjhaṅgo bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati …pe… anuppanno ceva upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo uppajjati, uppanno ca upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchatī”ti.
sn46.35:2.1.eng: “Mendicants, when you apply the mind rationally, the awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity arise, and once they’ve arisen, they’re fully developed.”

sn46.36:1.1.pli: “Sattime, bhikkhave, bojjhaṅgā bhāvitā bahulīkatā buddhiyā aparihānāya saṃvattanti.
sn46.36:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, when the seven awakening factors are developed and cultivated they lead to growth and progress.

sn46.36:1.3.eng: The awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.

sn46.36:1.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, satta bojjhaṅgā bhāvitā bahulīkatā buddhiyā aparihānāya saṃvattantī”ti.
sn46.36:1.4.eng: When these seven awakening factors are developed and cultivated they lead to growth and progress.”

sn46.37:1.1.pli: “Pañcime, bhikkhave, āvaraṇā nīvaraṇā cetaso upakkilesā paññāya dubbalīkaraṇā.
sn46.37:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are these five obstacles and hindrances, corruptions of the heart that weaken wisdom.

sn46.37:1.3.pli: Kāmacchando, bhikkhave, āvaraṇo nīvaraṇo cetaso upakkileso paññāya dubbalīkaraṇo.

sn46.37:1.4.pli: Byāpādo, bhikkhave, āvaraṇo nīvaraṇo cetaso upakkileso paññāya dubbalīkaraṇo.

sn46.37:1.5.pli: Thinamiddhaṃ, bhikkhave, āvaraṇaṃ nīvaraṇaṃ cetaso upakkilesaṃ paññāya dubbalīkaraṇaṃ.

sn46.37:1.6.pli: Uddhaccakukkuccaṃ, bhikkhave, āvaraṇaṃ nīvaraṇaṃ cetaso upakkilesaṃ paññāya dubbalīkaraṇaṃ.

sn46.37:1.7.pli: Vicikicchā, bhikkhave, āvaraṇā nīvaraṇā cetaso upakkilesā paññāya dubbalīkaraṇā.

sn46.37:1.8.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca āvaraṇā nīvaraṇā cetaso upakkilesā paññāya dubbalīkaraṇā.
sn46.37:1.8.eng: These are the five obstacles and hindrances, corruptions of the heart that weaken wisdom.

sn46.37:2.1.pli: Sattime, bhikkhave, bojjhaṅgā anāvaraṇā anīvaraṇā cetaso anupakkilesā bhāvitā bahulīkatā vijjāvimuttiphalasacchikiriyāya saṃvattanti.
sn46.37:2.1.eng: There are these seven awakening factors that are not obstacles, hindrances, or corruptions of the mind. When developed and cultivated they lead to the realization of the fruit of knowledge and freedom.

sn46.37:2.3.pli: Satisambojjhaṅgo, bhikkhave, anāvaraṇo anīvaraṇo cetaso anupakkileso bhāvito bahulīkato vijjāvimuttiphalasacchikiriyāya saṃvattati …pe… upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo, bhikkhave, anāvaraṇo anīvaraṇo cetaso anupakkileso bhāvito bahulīkato vijjāvimuttiphalasacchikiriyāya saṃvattati.
sn46.37:2.3.eng: The awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.

sn46.37:2.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, satta bojjhaṅgā anāvaraṇā anīvaraṇā cetaso anupakkilesā bhāvitā bahulīkatā vijjāvimuttiphalasacchikiriyāya saṃvattantīti.
sn46.37:2.4.eng: These seven awakening factors are not obstacles, hindrances, or corruptions of the mind. When developed and cultivated they lead to the realization of the fruit of knowledge and freedom.”

sn46.38:1.1.pli: Yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye ariyasāvako aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi katvā sabbaṃ cetaso samannāharitvā ohitasoto dhammaṃ suṇāti, imassa pañca nīvaraṇā tasmiṃ samaye na honti. Satta bojjhaṅgā tasmiṃ samaye bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchanti.
sn46.38:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, sometimes a noble disciple pays attention, applies the mind, concentrates wholeheartedly, and actively listens to the teaching. At such a time the five hindrances are absent, and the seven awakening factors are fully developed.

sn46.38:2.1.pli: Katame pañca nīvaraṇā tasmiṃ samaye na honti?
sn46.38:2.1.eng: What are the five hindrances that are absent?

sn46.38:2.2.pli: Kāmacchandanīvaraṇaṃ tasmiṃ samaye na hoti, byāpādanīvaraṇaṃ tasmiṃ samaye na hoti, thinamiddhanīvaraṇaṃ tasmiṃ samaye na hoti, uddhaccakukkuccanīvaraṇaṃ tasmiṃ samaye na hoti, vicikicchānīvaraṇaṃ tasmiṃ samaye na hoti.
sn46.38:2.2.eng: Sensual desire, ill will, dullness and drowsiness, restlessness and remorse, and doubt.

sn46.38:2.3.pli: Imassa pañca nīvaraṇā tasmiṃ samaye na honti.
sn46.38:2.3.eng: These are the five hindrances that are absent.

sn46.38:3.1.pli: Katame satta bojjhaṅgā tasmiṃ samaye bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchanti?
sn46.38:3.1.eng: And what are the seven awakening factors that are fully developed?

sn46.38:3.2.pli: Satisambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati …pe… upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati.
sn46.38:3.2.eng: The awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.

sn46.38:3.3.pli: Ime satta bojjhaṅgā tasmiṃ samaye bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchanti.
sn46.38:3.3.eng: These are the seven awakening factors that are fully developed.

sn46.38:3.4.pli: Yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye ariyasāvako aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi katvā sabbaṃ cetaso samannāharitvā ohitasoto dhammaṃ suṇāti, imassa pañca nīvaraṇā tasmiṃ samaye na honti. Ime satta bojjhaṅgā tasmiṃ samaye bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchantī”ti.
sn46.38:3.4.eng: Sometimes a noble disciple pays attention, applies the mind, concentrates wholeheartedly, and actively listens to the teaching. At such a time the five hindrances are absent, and the seven awakening factors are fully developed.”

sn46.39:1.1.pli: “Santi, bhikkhave, mahārukkhā aṇubījā mahākāyā rukkhānaṃ ajjhāruhā, yehi rukkhā ajjhārūḷhā obhaggavibhaggā vipatitā senti.
sn46.39:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are large trees with tiny seeds and big trunks, which grow up and around other trees as parasites. The trees they engulf break apart, collapse, and fall.

sn46.39:1.2.pli: Katame ca te, bhikkhave, mahārukkhā aṇubījā mahākāyā rukkhānaṃ ajjhāruhā, yehi rukkhā ajjhārūḷhā obhaggavibhaggā vipatitā senti?
sn46.39:1.2.eng: And what are those large trees with tiny seeds and big trunks?

sn46.39:1.3.pli: Assattho, nigrodho, pilakkho, udumbaro, kacchako, kapitthano—
sn46.39:1.3.eng: The peepal, banyan, wavy leaf fig, cluster fig, Moreton Bay fig, and portia.

sn46.39:1.4.pli: ime kho te, bhikkhave, mahārukkhā aṇubījā mahākāyā rukkhānaṃ ajjhāruhā, yehi rukkhā ajjhārūḷhā obhaggavibhaggā vipatitā senti.
sn46.39:1.4.eng: These are the large trees with tiny seeds and big trunks, which grow up and around other trees as parasites. The trees they engulf break apart, collapse, and fall.

sn46.39:1.5.pli: Evameva kho, bhikkhave, idhekacco kulaputto yādisake kāme ohāya agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti, so tādisakehi kāmehi tato vā pāpiṭṭhatarehi obhaggavibhaggo vipatito seti.
sn46.39:1.5.eng: In the same way, take a certain gentleman who has gone forth from the lay life to homelessness, abandoning sensual pleasures. But beset by sensual pleasures that are similar, or even worse, he breaks apart, collapses, and falls.

sn46.39:2.1.pli: Pañcime, bhikkhave, āvaraṇā nīvaraṇā cetaso ajjhāruhā paññāya dubbalīkaraṇā.
sn46.39:2.1.eng: There are these five obstacles and hindrances, parasites of the mind that weaken wisdom.

sn46.39:2.3.pli: Kāmacchando, bhikkhave, āvaraṇo nīvaraṇo cetaso ajjhāruho paññāya dubbalīkaraṇo.

sn46.39:2.4.pli: Byāpādo, bhikkhave, āvaraṇo nīvaraṇo cetaso ajjhāruho paññāya dubbalīkaraṇo.

sn46.39:2.5.pli: Thinamiddhaṃ, bhikkhave, āvaraṇaṃ nīvaraṇaṃ cetaso ajjhāruhaṃ paññāya dubbalīkaraṇaṃ.

sn46.39:2.6.pli: Uddhaccakukkuccaṃ, bhikkhave, āvaraṇaṃ nīvaraṇaṃ cetaso ajjhāruhaṃ paññāya dubbalīkaraṇaṃ.

sn46.39:2.7.pli: Vicikicchā, bhikkhave, āvaraṇā nīvaraṇā cetaso ajjhāruhā paññāya dubbalīkaraṇā.

sn46.39:2.8.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca āvaraṇā nīvaraṇā cetaso ajjhāruhā paññāya dubbalīkaraṇā.
sn46.39:2.8.eng: These are the five obstacles and hindrances, parasites of the mind that weaken wisdom.

sn46.39:3.1.pli: Sattime, bhikkhave, bojjhaṅgā anāvaraṇā anīvaraṇā cetaso anajjhāruhā bhāvitā bahulīkatā vijjāvimuttiphalasacchikiriyāya saṃvattanti.
sn46.39:3.1.eng: These seven awakening factors are not obstacles, hindrances, or parasites of the mind. When developed and cultivated they lead to the realization of the fruit of knowledge and freedom.

sn46.39:3.3.pli: Satisambojjhaṅgo, bhikkhave, anāvaraṇo anīvaraṇo cetaso anajjhāruho bhāvito bahulīkato vijjāvimuttiphalasacchikiriyāya saṃvattati …pe… upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo, bhikkhave, anāvaraṇo anīvaraṇo cetaso anajjhāruho bhāvito bahulīkato vijjāvimuttiphalasacchikiriyāya saṃvattati.
sn46.39:3.3.eng: The awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.

sn46.39:3.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, satta bojjhaṅgā anāvaraṇā anīvaraṇā cetaso anajjhāruhā bhāvitā bahulīkatā vijjāvimuttiphalasacchikiriyāya saṃvattantī”ti.
sn46.39:3.4.eng: These seven awakening factors are not obstacles, hindrances, or parasites of the mind. When developed and cultivated they lead to the realization of the fruit of knowledge and freedom.”

sn46.4:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā sāriputto sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
sn46.4:1.1.eng: At one time Venerable Sāriputta was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.

sn46.4:1.2.pli: Tatra kho āyasmā sāriputto bhikkhū āmantesi:

sn46.4:1.4.pli: “Āvuso”ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmato sāriputtassa paccassosuṃ.

sn46.4:2.3.pli: Satisambojjhaṅgo, dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo, vīriyasambojjhaṅgo, pītisambojjhaṅgo, passaddhisambojjhaṅgo, samādhisambojjhaṅgo, upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo—
sn46.4:2.3.eng: The awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.

sn46.4:2.4.eng: These are the seven awakening factors.

sn46.4:2.5.pli: Imesaṃ khvāhaṃ, āvuso, sattannaṃ bojjhaṅgānaṃ yena yena bojjhaṅgena ākaṅkhāmi pubbaṇhasamayaṃ viharituṃ, tena tena bojjhaṅgena pubbaṇhasamayaṃ viharāmi;
sn46.4:2.5.eng: In the morning, I meditate on whichever of these seven awakening factors I want.

sn46.4:2.6.pli: yena yena bojjhaṅgena ākaṅkhāmi majjhanhikaṃ samayaṃ viharituṃ, tena tena bojjhaṅgena majjhanhikaṃ samayaṃ viharāmi;

sn46.4:2.7.pli: yena yena bojjhaṅgena ākaṅkhāmi sāyanhasamayaṃ viharituṃ, tena tena bojjhaṅgena sāyanhasamayaṃ viharāmi.
sn46.4:2.7.eng: and in the evening, I meditate on whichever of these seven awakening factors I want.

sn46.4:2.8.pli: Satisambojjhaṅgo iti ce me, āvuso, hoti, ‘appamāṇo’ti me hoti, ‘susamāraddho’ti me hoti, tiṭṭhantañca naṃ ‘tiṭṭhatī’ti pajānāmi.
sn46.4:2.8.eng: If it’s the awakening factor of mindfulness, I know that it’s limitless and that it’s properly implemented. While it remains I understand that it remains.

sn46.4:2.9.pli: Sacepi me cavati, ‘idappaccayā me cavatī’ti pajānāmi …pe…
sn46.4:2.9.eng: And if it subsides in me I understand the specific reason it subsides. …

sn46.4:2.10.pli: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo iti ce me, āvuso, hoti, ‘appamāṇo’ti me hoti, ‘susamāraddho’ti me hoti, tiṭṭhantañca naṃ ‘tiṭṭhatī’ti pajānāmi.
sn46.4:2.10.eng: If it’s the awakening factor of equanimity, I know that it’s limitless and that it’s properly implemented. While it remains I understand that it remains.

sn46.4:2.11.pli: Sacepi me cavati, ‘idappaccayā me cavatī’ti pajānāmi.
sn46.4:2.11.eng: And if it subsides I understand the specific reason it subsides.

sn46.4:3.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, āvuso, rañño vā rājamahāmattassa vā nānārattānaṃ dussānaṃ dussakaraṇḍako pūro assa.
sn46.4:3.1.eng: Suppose that a ruler or their chief minister had a chest full of garments of different colors.

sn46.4:3.2.pli: So yaññadeva dussayugaṃ ākaṅkheyya pubbaṇhasamayaṃ pārupituṃ, taṃ tadeva dussayugaṃ pubbaṇhasamayaṃ pārupeyya;
sn46.4:3.2.eng: In the morning, they’d don whatever pair of garments they wanted.

sn46.4:3.3.pli: yaññadeva dussayugaṃ ākaṅkheyya majjhanhikaṃ samayaṃ pārupituṃ, taṃ tadeva dussayugaṃ majjhanhikaṃ samayaṃ pārupeyya;

sn46.4:3.4.pli: yaññadeva dussayugaṃ ākaṅkheyya sāyanhasamayaṃ pārupituṃ, taṃ tadeva dussayugaṃ sāyanhasamayaṃ pārupeyya.
sn46.4:3.4.eng: and in the evening, they’d don whatever pair of garments they wanted.

sn46.4:3.5.pli: Evameva khvāhaṃ, āvuso, imesaṃ sattannaṃ bojjhaṅgānaṃ yena yena bojjhaṅgena ākaṅkhāmi pubbaṇhasamayaṃ viharituṃ, tena tena bojjhaṅgena pubbaṇhasamayaṃ viharāmi;
sn46.4:3.5.eng: In the same way, in the morning,

sn46.4:3.6.pli: yena yena bojjhaṅgena ākaṅkhāmi majjhanhikaṃ samayaṃ viharituṃ, tena tena bojjhaṅgena majjhanhikaṃ samayaṃ viharāmi;

sn46.4:3.7.pli: yena yena bojjhaṅgena ākaṅkhāmi sāyanhasamayaṃ viharituṃ, tena tena bojjhaṅgena sāyanhasamayaṃ viharāmi.
sn46.4:3.7.eng: and in the evening, I meditate on whichever of these seven awakening factors I want.

sn46.4:3.8.pli: Satisambojjhaṅgo iti ce me, āvuso, hoti, ‘appamāṇo’ti me hoti, ‘susamāraddho’ti me hoti, tiṭṭhantañca naṃ ‘tiṭṭhatī’ti pajānāmi.
sn46.4:3.8.eng: If it’s the awakening factor of mindfulness, I know that it’s limitless and that it’s properly implemented. While it remains I understand that it remains.

sn46.4:3.9.pli: Sacepi me cavati, ‘idappaccayā me cavatī’ti pajānāmi …pe…
sn46.4:3.9.eng: And if it subsides I understand the specific reason it subsides. …

sn46.4:3.10.pli: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo iti ce me, āvuso, hoti, ‘appamāṇo’ti me hoti, ‘susamāraddho’ti me hoti, tiṭṭhantañca naṃ ‘tiṭṭhatī’ti pajānāmi.
sn46.4:3.10.eng: If it’s the awakening factor of equanimity, I know that it’s limitless and that it’s properly implemented. While it remains I understand that it remains.

sn46.4:3.11.pli: Sacepi me cavati, ‘idappaccayā me cavatī’ti pajānāmī”ti.
sn46.4:3.11.eng: And if it subsides I understand the specific reason it subsides.”

sn46.40:1.1.pli: “Pañcime, bhikkhave, nīvaraṇā andhakaraṇā acakkhukaraṇā aññāṇakaraṇā paññānirodhikā vighātapakkhiyā anibbānasaṃvattanikā.
sn46.40:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these five hindrances are destroyers of sight, vision, and knowledge. They block wisdom, they’re on the side of distress, and they don’t lead to extinguishment.

sn46.40:1.3.pli: Kāmacchandanīvaraṇaṃ, bhikkhave, andhakaraṇaṃ acakkhukaraṇaṃ aññāṇakaraṇaṃ paññānirodhikaṃ vighātapakkhiyaṃ anibbānasaṃvattanikaṃ.
sn46.40:1.3.eng: Sensual desire, ill will, dullness and drowsiness, restlessness and remorse, and doubt.

sn46.40:1.7.pli: vicikicchānīvaraṇaṃ, bhikkhave, andhakaraṇaṃ acakkhukaraṇaṃ aññāṇakaraṇaṃ paññānirodhikaṃ vighātapakkhiyaṃ anibbānasaṃvattanikaṃ.

sn46.40:1.8.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca nīvaraṇā andhakaraṇā acakkhukaraṇā aññāṇakaraṇā paññānirodhikā vighātapakkhiyā anibbānasaṃvattanikā.
sn46.40:1.8.eng: These five hindrances are destroyers of sight, vision, and knowledge. They block wisdom, they’re on the side of distress, and they don’t lead to extinguishment.

sn46.40:2.1.pli: Sattime, bhikkhave, bojjhaṅgā cakkhukaraṇā ñāṇakaraṇā paññābuddhiyā avighātapakkhiyā nibbānasaṃvattanikā.
sn46.40:2.1.eng: These seven awakening factors are creators of vision and knowledge. They grow wisdom, they’re on the side of solace, and they lead to extinguishment.

sn46.40:2.3.pli: Satisambojjhaṅgo, bhikkhave, cakkhukaraṇo ñāṇakaraṇo paññābuddhiyo avighātapakkhiyo nibbānasaṃvattaniko …pe… upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo, bhikkhave, cakkhukaraṇo ñāṇakaraṇo paññābuddhiyo avighātapakkhiyo nibbānasaṃvattaniko.
sn46.40:2.3.eng: The awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.

sn46.40:2.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, satta bojjhaṅgā cakkhukaraṇā ñāṇakaraṇā paññābuddhiyā avighātapakkhiyā nibbānasaṃvattanikā”ti.
sn46.40:2.4.eng: These seven awakening factors are creators of vision and knowledge. They grow wisdom, they’re on the side of solace, and they lead to extinguishment.”

sn46.41:1.2.pli: “Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, atītamaddhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā tisso vidhā pajahiṃsu, sabbe te sattannaṃ bojjhaṅgānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā.
sn46.41:1.2.eng: “Mendicants, all the ascetics and brahmins in the past who have given up the three discriminations have done so by developing and cultivating the seven awakening factors.

sn46.41:1.3.pli: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, anāgatamaddhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā tisso vidhā pajahissanti, sabbe te sattannaṃ bojjhaṅgānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā.
sn46.41:1.3.eng: All the ascetics and brahmins in the future who will give up the three discriminations will do so by developing and cultivating the seven awakening factors.

sn46.41:1.4.pli: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, etarahi samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā tisso vidhā pajahanti, sabbe te sattannaṃ bojjhaṅgānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā.
sn46.41:1.4.eng: All the ascetics and brahmins in the present who are giving up the three discriminations do so by developing and cultivating the seven awakening factors.

sn46.41:1.6.eng: The awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.

sn46.41:1.7.pli: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, atītamaddhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā tisso vidhā pajahiṃsu …pe…
sn46.41:1.7.eng: All the ascetics and brahmins in the past …

sn46.41:1.9.pli: pajahanti, sabbe te imesaṃyeva sattannaṃ bojjhaṅgānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā”ti.
sn46.41:1.9.eng: and present who give up the three discriminations do so by developing and cultivating the seven awakening factors.”

sn46.42:1.1.pli: “Rañño, bhikkhave, cakkavattissa pātubhāvā sattannaṃ ratanānaṃ pātubhāvo hoti.
sn46.42:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, when a Wheel-Turning Monarch appears seven treasures appear.

sn46.42:1.3.pli: Cakkaratanassa pātubhāvo hoti, hatthiratanassa pātubhāvo hoti, assaratanassa pātubhāvo hoti, maṇiratanassa pātubhāvo hoti, itthiratanassa pātubhāvo hoti, gahapatiratanassa pātubhāvo hoti, pariṇāyakaratanassa pātubhāvo hoti.
sn46.42:1.3.eng: The wheel, the elephant, the horse, the jewel, the woman, the householder, and the commander.

sn46.42:1.4.pli: Rañño, bhikkhave, cakkavattissa pātubhāvā imesaṃ sattannaṃ ratanānaṃ pātubhāvo hoti.
sn46.42:1.4.eng: When a Wheel-Turning Monarch appears these seven treasures appear.

sn46.42:2.1.pli: Tathāgatassa, bhikkhave, pātubhāvā arahato sammāsambuddhassa sattannaṃ bojjhaṅgaratanānaṃ pātubhāvo hoti.
sn46.42:2.1.eng: When a Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha appears the seven treasures of the awakening factors appear.

sn46.42:2.3.pli: Satisambojjhaṅgassa ratanassa pātubhāvo hoti …pe… upekkhāsambojjhaṅgassa ratanassa pātubhāvo hoti.
sn46.42:2.3.eng: The treasures of the awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.

sn46.42:2.4.pli: Tathāgatassa, bhikkhave, pātubhāvā arahato sammāsambuddhassa imesaṃ sattannaṃ bojjhaṅgaratanānaṃ pātubhāvo hotī”ti.
sn46.42:2.4.eng: When a Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha appears these seven treasures of the awakening factors appear.”

sn46.43:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you a path for crushing Māra’s army.

sn46.43:1.5.eng: It is the seven awakening factors.

sn46.43:1.7.eng: The awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.

sn46.43:1.8.eng: This is the path for crushing Māra’s army.”

sn46.44:1.1.pli: Atha kho aññataro bhikkhu yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami …pe… ekamantaṃ nisinno kho so bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn46.44:1.1.eng: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha … and asked him,

sn46.44:1.3.pli: Kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, ‘duppañño eḷamūgo’ti vuccatī”ti?
sn46.44:1.3.eng: How is a witless idiot defined?”

sn46.44:1.4.pli: “Sattannaṃ kho, bhikkhu, bojjhaṅgānaṃ abhāvitattā abahulīkatattā ‘duppañño eḷamūgo’ti vuccati.
sn46.44:1.4.eng: “Mendicant, they’re called a witless idiot because they haven’t developed and cultivated the seven awakening factors.

sn46.44:1.6.eng: The awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.

sn46.44:1.7.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhu, sattannaṃ bojjhaṅgānaṃ abhāvitattā abahulīkatattā ‘duppañño eḷamūgo’ti vuccatī”ti.
sn46.44:1.7.eng: They’re called a witless idiot because they haven’t developed and cultivated these seven awakening factors.”

sn46.45:1.1.eng: “Sir, they speak of a one ‘wise and clever’.

sn46.45:1.2.pli: Kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, ‘paññavā aneḷamūgo’ti vuccatī”ti?
sn46.45:1.2.eng: How is a person who is wise and clever defined?”

sn46.45:1.3.pli: “Sattannaṃ kho, bhikkhu, bojjhaṅgānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā ‘paññavā aneḷamūgo’ti vuccati.
sn46.45:1.3.eng: “Mendicant, they’re called wise and clever because they’ve developed and cultivated the seven awakening factors.

sn46.45:1.5.eng: The awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.

sn46.45:1.6.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhu, sattannaṃ bojjhaṅgānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā ‘paññavā aneḷamūgo’ti vuccatī”ti.
sn46.45:1.6.eng: They’re called wise and clever because they’ve developed and cultivated these seven awakening factors.”

sn46.46:1.1.eng: “Sir, they speak of someone who is ‘poor’.

sn46.46:1.2.eng: How is a poor person defined?”

sn46.46:1.3.pli: “Sattannaṃ kho, bhikkhu, bojjhaṅgānaṃ abhāvitattā abahulīkatattā ‘daliddo’ti vuccati.
sn46.46:1.3.eng: “Mendicant, they’re called poor because they haven’t developed and cultivated the seven awakening factors.

sn46.46:1.5.eng: The awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.

sn46.46:1.6.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhu, sattannaṃ bojjhaṅgānaṃ abhāvitattā abahulīkatattā ‘daliddo’ti vuccatī”ti.
sn46.46:1.6.eng: They’re called poor because they haven’t developed and cultivated these seven awakening factors.”

sn46.47:1.1.eng: “Sir, they speak of someone who is ‘prosperous’.

sn46.47:1.2.eng: How is a prosperous person defined?”

sn46.47:1.3.pli: “Sattannaṃ kho, bhikkhu, bojjhaṅgānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā ‘adaliddo’ti vuccati.
sn46.47:1.3.eng: “Mendicant, they’re called prosperous because they’ve developed and cultivated the seven awakening factors.

sn46.47:1.5.eng: The awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.

sn46.47:1.6.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhu, sattannaṃ bojjhaṅgānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā ‘adaliddo’ti vuccatī”ti.
sn46.47:1.6.eng: They’re called prosperous because they’ve developed and cultivated these seven awakening factors.”

sn46.48:1.1.pli: “Ādiccassa, bhikkhave, udayato etaṃ pubbaṅgamaṃ etaṃ pubbanimittaṃ, yadidaṃ—aruṇuggaṃ.
sn46.48:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, the dawn is the forerunner and precursor of the sunrise.

sn46.48:1.2.pli: Evameva kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno sattannaṃ bojjhaṅgānaṃ uppādāya etaṃ pubbaṅgamaṃ etaṃ pubbanimittaṃ, yadidaṃ—kalyāṇamittatā.
sn46.48:1.2.eng: In the same way, for a mendicant good friendship is the forerunner and precursor of the arising of the seven awakening factors.

sn46.48:1.3.pli: Kalyāṇamittassetaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno pāṭikaṅkhaṃ—satta bojjhaṅge bhāvessati, satta bojjhaṅge bahulīkarissati.
sn46.48:1.3.eng: A mendicant with good friends can expect to develop and cultivate the seven awakening factors.

sn46.48:1.4.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kalyāṇamitto satta bojjhaṅge bhāveti, satta bojjhaṅge bahulīkaroti?
sn46.48:1.4.eng: And how does a mendicant with good friends develop and cultivate the seven awakening factors?

sn46.48:1.5.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satisambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ …pe…
sn46.48:1.5.eng: It’s when a mendicant develops the awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion,

sn46.48:1.6.pli: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ.
sn46.48:1.6.eng: and equanimity, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.

sn46.48:1.7.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kalyāṇamitto satta bojjhaṅge bhāveti, satta bojjhaṅge bahulīkarotī”ti.
sn46.48:1.7.eng: That’s how a mendicant with good friends develops and cultivates the seven awakening factors.”

sn46.49:1.1.pli: “Ajjhattikaṃ, bhikkhave, aṅganti karitvā nāññaṃ ekaṅgampi samanupassāmi sattannaṃ bojjhaṅgānaṃ uppādāya, yathayidaṃ—bhikkhave, yonisomanasikāro.
sn46.49:1.1.eng: “Taking into account interior factors, mendicants, I do not see a single one that gives rise to the seven awakening factors like rational application of mind. …”

sn46.49:1.2.pli: Yonisomanasikārasampannassetaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno pāṭikaṅkhaṃ—satta bojjhaṅge bhāvessati, satta bojjhaṅge bahulīkarissati.

sn46.49:1.3.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yonisomanasikārasampanno satta bojjhaṅge bhāveti, satta bojjhaṅge bahulīkaroti?

sn46.49:1.4.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satisambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ …pe…

sn46.49:1.5.pli: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ.

sn46.49:1.6.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yonisomanasikārasampanno satta bojjhaṅge bhāveti, satta bojjhaṅge bahulīkarotī”ti.
